short_summary: Development of ISO TC 298 and TC 333 Standards
description: The Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) has a requirement to engage a contract to manage all aspects of the Canadian participation and leadership in the development of international standards for rare earth and lithium production through the Canadian Mirror Committee for ISO TC 298 and ISO TC 333, and its adoption process into Canada’s national standards system.
full_summary:
### Development of ISO TC 298 and TC 333 Standards

#### Solicitation Number: NRCan-5000073013 (176229)

*   **Title:** Development of ISO TC 298 and TC 333 Standards
*   **Solicitation Type:** Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
*   **Publication Date:** 27 February 2023
*   **Closing Date:** 14 March 2023 15:00:00
*   **Identification Number:** PW-23-01027966

**Procurement Details**

*   *Category:* Service (SRV)
*   *Method:* Competitive - Open Bidding
*   *Agreement*: International to ISO TC 298 and TC 333: 
    *   Logistics and administration for meetings and teleconferences
    *   Project management
    *   Procedural guidance
    *   Interaction with ISO central secretariat and other international bodies
    *   Member support, including insight into all required versions of standards
*   *Application*: Applicable Trade Agreements:
    1.  Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
    2.  World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
    3.  Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

#### Specific Requirements
The selected contractor must have a harmonized agreement with the Standard Council of Canada to work on ISO and IEC international standards. Moreover, the contractor must be accredited as a standards development organization by the Standard Council of Canada in order to work on standards development ISO TC298 rare earths and ISO TC333 lithium. The contractor should also have harmonized agreements to manage activities of the Rare Earths and Lithium SM/TC.

The main objective of this project is to develop ISO TC 298 and TC 333 standards for rare earths and lithium. The project involves several key tasks, including logistics and administration for meetings and teleconferences, project management, procedural guidance, interactions with ISO central secretariat and other international bodies, member support including insight into all required versions of standards, and all necessary materials related to standards development.

**Supplier Notice**

Natural Resources Canada invites interested suppliers to express their interest in this opportunity by submitting a statement of capabilities on or before the closing date. The statement must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements as outlined in the tender description.
